segment.source: WPR Quick Start
segment.target: WPR Quick Start

segment.source: WPR Quick Start
segment.target: WPR Quick Start

segment.source: This article summarizes the features that are available in the Windows Performance Recorder (WPR) user interface (UI).
segment.target: This article summarizes the features that are available in the Windows Performance Recorder (WPR) user interface (UI).

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: You can also run WPR from the command-line; for information about that option, see WPR Command-Line Options.
segment.target: You can also run WPR from the command-line; for information about that option, see WPR Command-Line Options.

segment.source: In this article:
segment.target: In this article:

segment.source: Recording by using the WPR Default Settings
segment.target: Recording by using the WPR Default Settings

segment.source: Using Recording Profiles
segment.target: Using Recording Profiles

segment.target: Using Performance Scenarios

segment.target: Using Detail Levels

segment.source: Using Logging Mode
segment.target: Using Logging Mode

segment.source: Recording by using the WPR Default Settings
segment.target: Recording by using the WPR Default Settings

segment.source: On the Start screen, click Windows Performance Recorder to open the WPR UI.
segment.target: On the Start screen, click Windows Performance Recorder to open the WPR UI.

segment.source: In WPR, click Start to record system performance by using the default settings from the General profile.
segment.target: In WPR, click Start to record system performance by using the default settings from the General profile.

segment.source: For more information about this feature, see Start a Recording and Recording for Basic System Diagnosis.
segment.target: For more information about this feature, see Start a Recording and Recording for Basic System Diagnosis.

segment.source: Using Recording Profiles
segment.target: Using Recording Profiles

segment.source: WPR recording profiles contain all the information that is necessary to enable performance recording for a specific scenario.
segment.target: WPR recording profiles contain all the information that is necessary to enable performance recording for a specific scenario.

segment.source: You can include multiple profiles in a single recording.
segment.target: You can include multiple profiles in a single recording.

segment.source: For general information about WPR profiles, see Recording Profiles.
segment.target: For general information about WPR profiles, see Recording Profiles.

segment.source: WPR provides a wide selection of built-in recording profiles that are sorted into groups by function.
segment.target: WPR provides a wide selection of built-in recording profiles that are sorted into groups by function.

segment.source: For more information about WPR built-in profiles, see Built-in Recording Profiles and Select Built-in Profiles.
segment.target: For more information about WPR built-in profiles, see Built-in Recording Profiles and Select Built-in Profiles.

segment.source: You can also author and add custom profiles (.wprp files) to record sets of events.
segment.target: You can also author and add custom profiles (.wprp files) to record sets of events.

segment.source: For more information about custom profiles, see Authoring Recording Profiles and Add or Remove a Custom Recording Profile.
segment.target: For more information about custom profiles, see Authoring Recording Profiles and Add or Remove a Custom Recording Profile.

segment.source: Using Performance Scenarios
segment.target: Using Performance Scenarios

segment.source: You can use performance scenarios to record common scenarios such as on/off transitions or heap analysis.
segment.target: You can use performance scenarios to record common scenarios such as on/off transitions or heap analysis.

segment.source: You can select only one scenario for a recording.
segment.target: You can select only one scenario for a recording.

segment.source: For more information about performance scenarios, see WPR Scenarios and Change the Performance Scenario.
segment.target: For more information about performance scenarios, see WPR Scenarios and Change the Performance Scenario.

segment.source: Using detail levels
segment.target: Using detail levels

segment.source: You can select a detail level for each recording.
segment.target: You can select a detail level for each recording.

segment.source: The available levels are Light and Verbose.
segment.target: The available levels are Light and Verbose.

segment.source: The Light detail level is used primarily for timing recordings.
segment.target: The Light detail level is used primarily for timing recordings.

segment.source: The Verbose detail level provides the detailed information that you need for analysis.
segment.target: The Verbose detail level provides the detailed information that you need for analysis.

segment.source: For more information about detail levels, see Detail Level and Change the Detail Level.
segment.target: For more information about detail levels, see Detail Level and Change the Detail Level.

segment.source: Selecting a logging mode
segment.target: Selecting a logging mode

segment.source: WPR can log events either to a sequential file or to circular buffers in memory.
segment.target: WPR can log events either to a sequential file or to circular buffers in memory.

segment.source: Logging to a file is used for short traces, when you know when to expect the events that you want to trace.
segment.target: Logging to a file is used for short traces, when you know when to expect the events that you want to trace.

segment.source: Logging to memory is used for continuous tracing, when you want to log events that can occur at any time.
segment.target: Logging to memory is used for continuous tracing, when you want to log events that can occur at any time.

segment.source: General scenarios can use both types of logging.
segment.target: General scenarios can use both types of logging.

segment.source: However, on/off transitions can only use file logging.
segment.target: However, on/off transitions can only use file logging.

segment.source: For more information about logging modes, see Logging Mode and Change the Logging Mode.
segment.target: For more information about logging modes, see Logging Mode and Change the Logging Mode.
